comments:
I have a plugin that uses a jar (myjar) that in turn uses the saaj-impl.jar from
the SUN web service pack. When I run myjar from the command line, the
saaj-impl.jar is loaded and everything works fine. However, when I run my plugin
in eclipse using the same jars, it doesn't work. I got the following message:

[Loaded com.sun.xml.rpc.spi.runtime.SOAPMessageContext from
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseClassLoader]
[Loaded com.sun.xml.rpc.soap.message.SOAPMessageContext from
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseClassLoader]
[Loaded javax.xml.soap.SOAPMessage from
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseClassLoader]
[Loaded javax.xml.soap.SOAPException from
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseClassLoader]
java.rmi.RemoteException: Couldn't create SOAP message factory due to exception:
javax.xml.soap.SOAPException: Unable to create message factory for SOAP:
Provider com.sun.xml.messaging.saaj.soap.ver1_1.SOAPMessageFactory1_1Impl not
found; nested exception is: 
	Couldn't create SOAP message factory due to exception:
javax.xml.soap.SOAPException: Unable to create message factory for SOAP:
Provider com.sun.xml.messaging.saaj.soap.ver1_1.SOAPMessageFactory1_1Impl not found
	at seqRunner.SeqRunnerIF_Stub.execute(SeqRunnerIF_Stub.java:87)


Even though eclipse uses a different classLoader, should they both work?

Thanks for your help,
*** Bug 87972 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Do you expect the JAR containing the
com.sun.xml.messaging.saaj.soap.ver1_1.SOAPMessageFactory1_1Impl class to be in
the plug-in classpath? How are you doing that?

FYI -- 

This appears to be the same issue that was discussed in this newsgroup thread:

http://dev.eclipse.org/newslists/news.eclipse.platform/msg32248.html
Is it, Taifun? Please reopen of it is not the case.

traces.message: Unable to create message factory for SOAP: Provider com.sun.xml.messaging.saaj.soap.ver1_1.SOAPMessageFactory1_1Impl not found
